intro: Sieversia canescens, commonly known as the grayleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. Its leaves are grayish-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinct central disk. Sieversia canescens is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
